SRP.Q: In the chord chart, what is the next arc in the clockwise direction from arc Alex Laboratory?
SRP.A: The next arc clockwise from arc Alex Laboratory is arc {Herman Research Center}.

SRP.A: The next arc counterclockwise from arc Alex Laboratory is arc {Jessicatown School}.

VPR.A: {Herman Research Center} has the largest output flow.

VPR.A: {Fleming-Rosario Academy} has the largest input flow.

NF.Q: Which pairs of nodes in the chord chart have a flow greater than 52? Please list the source node, target node, and the corresponding flow value.

NC.Q: Which flow is larger: from Fleming-Rosario Academy to Alex Laboratory or from Fleming-Rosario Academy to Jessicatown School?
NC.A: The flow from {Fleming-Rosario Academy} to {Jessicatown School} is larger.

NC.Q: Which flow is the largest: from Herman Research Center to Jessicatown School, from Fleming-Rosario Academy to Jessicatown School, or from Herman Research Center to Fleming-Rosario Academy?
NC.A: The flow from {Herman Research Center} to {Fleming-Rosario Academy} is the largest.

MSR.Q: Which category has the highest proportion of outgoing flow relative to its total flow?

MSR.Q: Which pair has the strongest chord connection in this chord chart?
MSR.A: The strongest chord connection is between {Fleming-Rosario Academy} and {Herman Research Center}.

VA.Q: To minimize the crossings between chords, please reorder the outer arcs and list the reorder arc order in clockwise direction.
VA.A: The reordered arc order in clockwise direction is: {Arc Alex Laboratory, Arc Fleming-Rosario Academy, Arc Jessicatown School, Arc Herman Research Center}.
